page.title: 06ECOLOGY OF BURY AREA
page.content: The wildlife in this area is mainly in old,well established gardens.This is because the fens around here are very flat and monotonous,and don't have the dykes,hedges and trees wildlife depend on.Housing developement hasn't really affected the wildlife,but chemicals and modern crop growing methods have. Wistow Wood isn't part of the National Trust,but is looked after by the Hunts and Beds naturalists trust.It's mainly an oak ash establishment,and has been planted up over several hundred years. Just off from Shillow Hill is a big house set in tall trees.In this a large rookery has been built up.Also the pond boasts one of the largest populations of the fairly rare Great-Crested Newt.
